On Tue, 08 Jun 2004 23:12:42 -0000, Kenneth Stanley
<kstanley@...> wrote:
> -Is the structure mutation rate issue fixed (as in the mutation
> rates have been adjusted down accordingly)?

The mutation rates for XOR and TTT are the same as the ones we used
for the paper, so in that sense, no.  Those parameters can easily be
modified by editing the corresponding properties file.

> -Perhaps documentation should include where to get the necessary
> files to make a browser XML capable?

Okay...we put a reference to the NEVT site in the Quick Start Guide.

> -I could only unzip it in Unix.  I really can't do it in Windows
> XP.  It's no doubt Windows' fault, but still, if I have this problem
> others probably will as well.  Who knows why.  But because of this I
> would suggest using a different zipper to package it up.

We're using Ant, which has a .zip component that's using the
"Info-zip" implementation.  Not really sure why it's not working in
your Windows environment.  We're both using WinXP's built-in zip/unzip
utility and aren't having that problem.

> Nice job!  I'll add the links.

Thanks!

Derek
